documentari china today resembl night - fill with imagination. for a long period of time china wa a countri that did not like to discuss dark or night. for decad the "red sun" wa the most direct form of allow imagination. under today' sun offic build and construct sight domin one' vision. but in the even everyth changes, and you can see the spiritu life of the people. even everywher provid us with an opportun to see ourselves, as through a mirror' reflection. in the even human is alway more sensit and vulnerable. in it dark we are cloak in intimaci and obscurity. all through the day, peopl work hard to put on and maintain appearances, and daytim resembl a stage on which peopl perform. yet dure the even we are abl to wander backstage. today, china is no longer in the gener of the "red sun". now we can see a differ side of china' red sun. the realiti of china today is a microcosm of the world. china is not just a socialist country; it' no longer that simple. today the leader of china have told the world they are construct a socialist countri with "chines characteristics". but what are "chines characteristics"? "night in china" is my own view of what these characterist are. thi documentari is about the backstag of chines characteristics; a side of it realiti that is rare examined. in thi film you will not see daytim in china, as all of the stori occur between dusk and dawn. yet the night is like a tension that can be stretch so far that through the night you can better understand people' day. if china is a metaphor for a person, the day resembl the skin and hair. the night is the bone and inner organs. with thi in mind my camera len will be like a scope probe through the insid of a person' body. "night in china" will not onli let you see china' reality, but it will also let you see it more surreal side. anqiju
